CatDescriptText: Mr. Aaron Grimsley, 541 Herron Avenue and Mr. William Tucker, 812 Whiteside Road, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?" Aaron Grimsley's answer reads: "I don't think so. I don't think that it benefits them.  The more schooling that they get, the better.  If they go out on strike the only losers are they."  William Tucker's answer reads: "I don't think that they should, because I don't see how it benefits them.  While they are on strike they are not learning anything.  I honestly don't think that the school system carries out a program that is so radical as to make the children go out on strike."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Aaron Grimsley wearing light colored cap and plaid shirt, and William Tucker, standing in front of stone block wall
